name: TheAtlantic
text: "The president believed he could bluff the virus into submission, the way he’s successfully bluffed many political opponents before. The terrible numbers on infections and hospitalizations show that it didn’t work," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/2U6Jt5pIgE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senator Kamala Harris wants to be Joe Biden's running mate. She just won't say so. @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/Y4g5nBFFIc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Once the epicenter of the global pandemic, New York is trying to discourage visitors from new coronavirus hotspots, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/WhBgSJquP5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Britain has finally passed a new law allowing for no-fault divorce, all without a culture war, writes @helenlewis: https://t.co/s1a3NPU61H

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mountaintop yoga in China, a sunrise over Glastonbury Tor, a sneaky gull in Denmark, a field of lavender in England, “Rays of Victory” in Russia, a concert for plants in Spain, a ski run in Australia, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/cVMVW1KpQh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Four Dutch teens were in the Caribbean for a study-at-sea program when the pandemic shut down travel—so they sailed home, all the way across the Atlantic, to the Netherlands. @julieebeck spoke with them for The Friendship Files: https://t.co/AP6SpqQZ6g

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This is the time to move. This is the time to make change." @JulianCastro talks with @AdamSerwer about police reform, the housing crisis, and his own political future: https://t.co/VvF1lkIOJN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases are on the rise in twenty-five states. A vaccine is, for now, a distant dream. How do we negotiate the ethical trade-offs in the meantime? https://t.co/DzfWUFFFna

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Even quarantine fatigue feels old now. Whether you live in an area that is reopening or one that is experiencing a new surge of cases, our critics can help. Here’s what to read, listen to, and watch this weekend. https://t.co/iEdmDM4kCe
